Material used.Description: Recombinant DJ-1 protein was used for the experiment.

Readout description.Result Description: The A104T mutation reduces the thermal stability of DJ-1 and introduces a disordered polar residue and water molecule into the hydrophobic core.
The E163K mutation disrupts a critical salt bridge with R145, leading to increased mobility of R145 and destabilization of the protein.
The M26I mutation causes packing defects in the core of the protein, resulting in minor thermal destabilization.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple independent protein preparations were used.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was measured multiple times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 protein was used as a positive control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: The data were processed by reference thermogram subtraction, concentration normalization, and progress baseline subtraction in the ORIGIN software package for DSC analysis.

Material used.Description: Recombinant DJ-1 protein was used for the experiment.

Readout description.Result Description: The A104T mutation does not significantly alter the secondary structure of DJ-1.
The E163K mutation does not significantly alter the secondary structure of DJ-1.
The M26I mutation does not significantly alter the secondary structure of DJ-1.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple independent protein preparations were used.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was measured multiple times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 protein was used as a positive control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Spectra were normalized to units of mean molar residue ellipticity using protein concentrations determined by A280.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Secondary structure content similar to wild-type DJ-1

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant changes in secondary structure content

Material used.Description: Recombinant DJ-1 protein was used for the experiment.

Readout description.Result Description: The A104T mutation does not affect the dimerization of DJ-1.
The E163K mutation does not affect the dimerization of DJ-1.
The M26I mutation does not affect the dimerization of DJ-1.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple independent protein preparations were used.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was measured multiple times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 protein was used as a positive control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: The data were analyzed using the Origin 6.0 data analysis software provided by the manufacturer.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Monomeric or higher-order oligomeric states detected
